meaning_str.bing:
v. 允许；同意
n. （政府、机构的）拨款
网络. 授予；格兰特；准予

同意；批准；允许；提供；给予；准予；授予；（勉强）承认
（政府等发给的）拨款；补助金；资助；（政府给予的）土地；授与物；（Grant）格朗；格兰特（人名）

1.en: Grant then decided to surround the city and wait until its food was gone. That, he thought, would make the Confederates surrender.
1.cn: 格兰特随后决定包围维克斯堡，一直等到城里弹尽粮绝，他想以此迫使南方军投降。

2.en: "He'd have loved to have had Cary Grant in the role, but there wasn't enough money for that. " Says Connery.
2.cn: 康纳利说“他本来选取定卡里·格兰特扮演该角色，但因为钱不够，所以他只得同意由我来演。”

3.en: From the time the declaration was issued, Adams's allies in America had been asking me to grant him a visa to visit the United States.
3.cn: 自《原则宣言》发布之日起，亚当斯在美国的支持者就要求我给他发放访问美国的签证。

0.en: It does not grant citizenship, or the right to stay here permanently or offer the same benefits that citizens receive.
0.cn: 它不涉及授予国籍，给予永久在此的权力，或者提供正式公民拥有的相同的福利。

1.en: Come. I will grant you the fel.

2.en: We got the grant. Three years, all expenses paid.
2.cn: 我们已申请到奖助金，全额赞助我们三年。

3.en: And Ben Grant, founder of Pollyhop. I saw the webcast.
3.cn: 还有本·格兰特，波利跳的创始人。我看到网络直播了。

4.en: You're working on a grant proposal for a new fusion reactor. I'm working on a grant proposal for a new fusion reactor.
4.cn: 你在申请基金研究关于聚变反应堆，我也在申请基金研究关于聚变反应堆。

5.en: Yes, Jeffrey Grant, the guy on trial. He was in here.
5.cn: 对，杰弗里·格兰特，那个正在受审的家伙，他那晚在这儿。

6.en: When Jeffrey Grant started shooting, he tried to, take the gun.
6.cn: 杰弗里·格兰特开枪时，他试图夺下手枪。

7.en: You don't grant birthday wishes, do you? I'm a priest, not a genie.
7.cn: 你不能实现生日愿望的，是吗？我是神父，不是鬼怪。

8.en: Jeffrey Grant's card key has him entering his dorm room at 7:49 P.M.
8.cn: 杰弗里·格兰特在7点49分刷卡，进入宿舍。

9.en: The S.A. is looking for a scapegoat in the Jeffrey Grant prosecution.
9.cn: 州检察官在为杰弗里·格兰特的起诉找替罪羊。

10.en: The National Science Foundation wants to give me a substantial grant.
10.cn: 国家科学基金会要给我一大笔奖金。

11.en: Yeah, I was... Anyway, look. I definitely did not apply for your grant.
11.cn: 对，我是……随便了，那个，我绝对没申请过你的基金。

12.en: I mean, what is immortality? In time, even Grant's vision will get old.
12.cn: 永生究竟是什么？过个几十年格兰特的设想也会过时。

13.en: Well, he has an election coming up and this Grant issue could haunt him.
13.cn: 他即将面临选举，而这个格兰特案可能会把他拉下马。

14.en: How do I know that Mr. Grant did this? There were no video cameras there.
14.cn: 我怎么知道是格兰特先生做的呢？那里没有摄像头。

15.en: And as my wife, I think you should grant me this favor. We did make vows.
15.cn: 而身为我的老婆，你应该帮我这个忙，我们发过誓了。

16.en: Grant me the fel in front of them, let them see how much stronger I become.
16.cn: 在他们面前赐予我魔能，让他们看到... 我将变得多么的强壮。

17.en: Mr. Grant tried to rape Dani Littlejohn and when she resisted, he killed her.
17.cn: 格兰特先生试图强奸达妮·利特约翰她奋力反抗，于是被其杀害。

18.en: We'd love to, Your Honor, but we're rearresting Mr. Grant on a murder charge.
18.cn: 我们愿意，法官阁下，但是我们以谋杀指控再次逮捕格兰特先生。

19.en: Jeffrey Grant was a tragedy. We had an ASA who was looking to make his bones.
19.cn: 杰弗里·格兰特案是个悲剧，我们有个想崭露头角的助理州检察官。
